title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 11 ยง 27.6 - Documents to be filed with excess line association
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 11 ยง 27.6 - Documents to be filed with excess line association

State Regulations
(a) Within 45 days after date of procurement of a policy from an unauthorized insurer, the excess line broker shall submit to the excess line association, for recording and stamping, all documents required by section
2118
of the Insurance Law, including all affidavits required by section
27.5
of this Part. (b) An excess line broker shall not deliver, or provide to any producing broker for delivery, an excess line insurance policy declarations page or cover note unless the first page of the declarations page or cover note bears the stamp applied by the excess line association or a duplicate copy of the declarations page or cover note bearing the stamp is attached to the original. Notes

ยง

Amended, New

York State Register October 8, 2014/Volume XXXVI, Issue 40, eff. 10/8/2014

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
